item.title: [SAK-23845] Web Content - When adding web content link the interface mentions "Options" which has been replaced
item.description:
Love the changes to Web Content in Sakai 2.9 -- great that the new window actually opens in a new window. As we're preparing to launch Sakai 2.9 at our institution, a member of our team noticed that as an instructor adds a web link (Site Info > Edit Tools > select Web Content) the on-screen instructions mention "Options." However, with Sakai 2.9 the "Options" button has been replaced with the little edit icon.

Steps to replicate:
1. Site Info
2. Edit Tools
3. Select Web Content
4. Inaccurate text displays at top:

"Add Multiple Tool Instances

"Add multiple tool instances or configure tool options. You can also make configuration adjustments later in the site using the Options menu for each tool instance."

**********************************

Looks like the Web Content selection of Edit Tools uses the same engine as News and others. I reviewed the common tools to see which used the new "edit" icon and which had the older "options" button. Here's what I found:

- External Tool -- same screen/language when adding, new "edit" icon in the tool.
- Lessons -- same screen/language when adding, no "options" or "edit" buttons in tool.
- Link Tool -- same screen/language when adding, has a "setup" button instead (not "options" or new edit icon).
- News -- same screen/language when adding, old "Options" button.
- Web Content -- same screen/language when adding, new "edit" icon in the tool.

**********************************

The main title and description can be improved. Given that there are multiple options right now (inconsistent), perhaps the following language could help? It's just a suggestion and should be reviewed by others for improvements. It would be great if we could standardize the interface to simplify instructions and user experience, but one step at a time. :)


Configure Tool(s)

Please supply the information below to add the selected tool(s). After a tool has been added, you can edit these and other settings by visiting the tool and clicking the appropriate configuration button.
item.summary: Web Content - When adding web content link the interface mentions "Options" which has been replaced

comments.comment: Alan, please clarify. This looks like a really easy and extremely well-described fix :) Get the wording to match the reality. Did I miss something?

This is actually a string in the site-manage/site-manage-tool/tool/src/bundle/sitesetupgeneric.properties

I would suggest the following wording change to make it more generic.

multipleTools.custom=Add multiple tool instances or configure tool options. You can also make configuration adjustments later in the site using the configuration capabilities for each tool.

Make sense? This should probably be reassigned to Zhen or Beth - but I am happy to just commit the fix and schedule it for 2-9-x merge unless someone jumps up and down.

You're 100% correct, Dr. Chuck. Hopefully a quick, simple fix to make the wording fit the new look and feel. Your suggestion is fine.

FYI, I found one more element that needs to be updated. In the "webcontent-nowebsite-language.jpg" screenshot, you can see that the Web Content tool has some helper information that needs to be updated. I never ran into this, since I have never left that field blank before. One of our testers pointed this out to me.

Steps to replicate:
1. Site Info > Edit Tools > select Web Content > Continue
2. Click Continue (leave the web address the default http://)
3. Finish
4. Click Web Content in the left menu
5. You'll see the helper information that needs to be updated.

Currently reads:

"Web Content Setup

"Use this tool to point to a web page of your choice.

"Click the Options button, and enter the web page address in the URL field.

"For example, to make this tool display the Google search page, you would enter www.google.com in the URL field on the Options form."

************

Lines 3 and 4 need to be updated. Perhaps --

"Click the edit icon (image) at the top right and enter the website address in the URL field.

"For example, to make this tool display the Google search page, you would enter www.google.com in the URL field on the customization form."

*****

In line 3, the "(image)" item would be inserting the actual edit icon on the page for a visual cue, if possible. No worries if not.

In line 4, I used "customization" form because the edit screen says "Customize Web Content" as the heading.

Thanks so much!
These strings live in site-manage.

item.title: [SAK-23805] config.sitemanage.moreInfoDir property default will not work
item.description:
The SAK-16600 issue introduced new functionality, including the ability to specify a "more info" link for tools, which will load images in the config.sitemanage.moreInfoDir directory.

The default directory location for this is "/library/images/", but the code currently requires that there be no leading slash ("/"), or the location will not correctly resolve, so the specified default does not work.

Suggest changing the code to allow/require a leading slash since this specifies a relative URL (rather than changing the default value). Support for specifying a web location (e.g. https://someserver/library/images/ would be really nice, but this is an enhancement.
item.summary: config.sitemanage.moreInfoDir property default will not work

item.title: [SAK-23308] Add FullCalendar javascript plugin to Sakai library
item.description: We're developing an integration between Google calendar and Sakai as a contrib tool that uses the FullCalendar javascript library (http://arshaw.com/fullcalendar/). This code is released under the MIT license. This license is compatible with our own (https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/LIC/3rd+Party+Licenses+and+Software), so I'd like to provide this code in a branch.
item.summary: Add FullCalendar javascript plugin to Sakai library

comments.comment: Commit to to trunk!
Hi Beth, Do you have any plans to merge these branch commits into trunk before the next major release?

No plans unless someone else would like to see this in trunk. Our contrib project is now documented at https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/GCAL/Google+Calendar and we hope to deploy as a stealth tool in the Fall.

item.title: [GOOGLE-1] Create Google Calendar API for adding/removing events
item.description:
Other Sakai tool (e.g. Assignments) will need to add and remove events from the google calendar by implementing the Calendar, CalendarService and CalendarEvent (interface) API. Note that many methods will be stubs, but methods that will be needed include:

CalendarService.getCalendar()
CalendarEvent.getId()
Calendar.getEvent()
Calendar.getEditEvent()
Calendar.addEvent()
Calenda.removeEvent()
Calendar.commitEvent()

This is an initial list (more may be needed as we start the integration work).
item.summary: Create Google Calendar API for adding/removing events

item.title: [EVALSYS-1352] Rework consolidated notifications to accumulate data in memory rather than database
item.description: The current consolidated-notification code performs poorly (or not at all) with MySQL. Instead of trying to accumulate the data for these emails with complex joins, we should try doing it in memory.
item.summary: Rework consolidated notifications to accumulate data in memory rather than database

comments.comment: Attaching patch file showing changes needed to make this work.

A patch file has been attached. This patch is based on the 1.5.x branch of evalsys (which is trunk as of 12/15/2012). It will need a little tweaking for evalsys 1.4.x or earlier. In particular, this code relies on a new method, EvalAssignUser.getCompletedDate() at line 1252 of org.sakaiproject.evaluation.logic.EvalEmailsLogicImpl. Instead of using that method to determine whether a user has completed an evaluation in 1.4.x and before, it will be necessary to retrieve the corresponding EvalResponce. If that is found, the record can be scipped.
Beth: I am still watching a test of this on durango, but it seems to be performing well. Do you want to set up a code-review?

The patch file attached to the ticket has all of the changes made to the EVALSYS-1352A branch. That would be the basis for code review. The code is here:

https://source.sakaiproject.org/contrib/evaluation/branches/EVALSYS-1352A/

It looks to me like there is a problem with the current version. The email processing code has run a few more times over the weekend without any issues, but this morning, it seems to have stalled. I think there may be a deadlock. The only indication I see are these tqo log messages:

2012-12-15 10:01:00,981 INFO QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 org.sakaiproject.evaluation.jobmonitor.LoggingJobStatusReporter - JobStatus. Job: Email. Milestone: buildingQueue, Detail: ConsolidatedReminder: Processed 4500 evals of 7800; Evaluators in queue for email: 28254
2012-12-15 10:06:25,370 INFO Timer-1 org.sakaiproject.evaluation.logic.EvalEvaluationSetupServiceImpl - Checking the state of 7800 evaluations to ensure they are all up to date...

It's been ~50 minutes with no further indication of a problem, but thew CPU for the evaluation process is low and the memory usage reported by the "top" command seems to be stable at about 10.9 %. I am unable to attach with the profiler. I suspect a deadlock.

The QuartzScheduler_Worker-2 thread is iterating through all of the active EvalEvaluation objects in the system, and the Timer-1 is trying to do the same for a different purpose. Could it be that both threads are blocking on some particular EvalEvaluation object?

If so, maybe a fix would be to get a lock to prevent one process from starting until the other process completes?

Also, it may be possible that the email processing code is holding onto EvalEvaluation objects longer than necessary. Maybe it should iterate through those objects quickly to get any needed information and then discard the entities themselves before starting to process the assignments of evals to users.

Thoughts?

item.title: [UMICH-713] Add tracking of HTTP connections stats to CTStats
item.description:
CTStats should track the current number of HTTP connections to the CTools app servers. This is one of the settings that needed to be adjusting during the deployment of CTIR so keeping track of it is appropriate as the usage of CTools evolves.

This requires writing a script to track the state of connections using snmpnetstat. The data recorded will be the total number of connections in each state.

This does not appear possible using snmpnetstat. A new approach, possibly, using a force command, is required.

item.description: The CTools custom 403 and 404 pages are not being delivered, users are getting generic errors of they try to access a resource without permission or try to access a resource that doesn't exist. I believe that the 503 page is not used but Apache or the load balancer is directing appropriately to a page outside of CTools.

The 403 page is commented out in apache configuration (UMICH-347), which explains why it's not delivered (though not why it's commented out).

Can you provide an example of a 404 page not being delivered? I just tried the following URL and the custom 404 page was displayed: https://ctools.umich.edu/oaf

The following URL provides access to an existing document in a public folder. It works as expected.

https://ctools.umich.edu/access/content/group/f07287fd-3d21-4a68-0037-8d3ff712ea8f/ErrorPageTests/PresentDocumentTxt

Jeff Ziegler also did some testing. Here are his results as copied from an email. The images referenced have been attached the jira.

RESULTS:

<see: site unavailable.png>

item.title: [UMICH-604] Simplify ctstats configuration
item.description: Currently configuration of the CTStats systems requires synchronized updating of several configuration files with redundant information. It would be straightforward to write a script to automate creation of the configuration files based on a single master file.
item.summary: Simplify ctstats configuration

item.title: [UMICH-603] Eliminate need to manually update graphs when servers in a cluster change
item.description:
For historical reasons some CTStats data collection scripts do not keep data files for individual servers in a way that makes it easy to determine which cluster the server is in. This complicates CTStats administration significantly. In particular it means that some graphs need to be updated whenever the set of servers changes. The data collection scripts should be modified to make the cluster clear and the graphs should be updated to take advantage of that.

The data files can be segregated by either ensuring the cluster name is prepended to the RRD file name or by putting all the files for the same cluster in an appropriately named subdirectory.

With that change the current graphs that need to know about the server names can be changed to be templates that can be used for any cluster.
item.summary: Eliminate need to manually update graphs when servers in a cluster change

item.title: [SAK-22306] Resources should support drag and drop uploads
item.description:
The desire is to have file drag and drop support (like in gmail) in the resources tool in Sakai. Ideally supporting multiple files.

AZ assessment:
My quick assessment is that the approach seems OK and modular enough
to backport when people want to. I think multiple file upload would be
a real leap forward if that's possible.

We *might* want to consider a property to enable or disable it but
that's only if there are cases where it might not work (like certain
browsers or file types).

It also looks like this does its own zip file handling. That should
probably be removed.


From John Bush:
So there was a little licensing hiccup with the javascript library we
are using, http://valums.com/ajax-upload/. I spoken with the
developer and he's super cool, and going to add the MIT license to his
list. The MIT license is compatible with Sakai:
https://confluence.sakaiproject.org/display/LIC/3rd+Party+Licenses+and+Software

If you haven't seen the demo, check it out here:
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3F2deBm7O44

Unfortunately I ramble on way too long at the beginning, just fast
forward over all the crap. Was feeling lonely and chatty I guess,
talking to a computer, so sad.

The patch is attached. What is still needed is an ability to do more
than one file at once, and probably a switch to turn this feature off.
 I think those are pretty quick things to work out. I'd like to
understand more how this is related to other projects in the works.
item.summary: Resources should support drag and drop uploads

comments.comment: I am attaching a new patch for this that applies against trunk. The new patch allows for drag and drop with multiple files. We also added a property to toggle this feature, dragAndDropFileUpload, which defaults to false.
Its looks like the valums project has moved here: https://github.com/Widen/fine-uploader. The license is now GNU v3.0. I think we are back at having a licensing hiccup with this.
https://github.com/SimonWaldherr/uploader - Though this version looks a little old, but it does seem to be the last license compatible version unless something can be negotiated.

Ok good, so really then the only question is, are we comfortable with relying on essentially a dead library, because it sounds like https://github.com/SimonWaldherr/uploader is dead and replaced by https://github.com/Widen/fine-uploader. If the answer is no, then I suppose we need to start looking for alternatives.
We found http://www.dropzonejs.com/, which looks like an MIT license. We are refactoring this patch to use that instead.
We are just about done with refactoring this to use dropzonejs and the UI is cooler than it was before, we should a patch to kick around at the conference.
Attaching a patch for drag and drop using dropzonejs instead of valums/file-uploader.
Attaching a new patch with some css tweaks and fixes for issues that were discovered at the conference. Also, the property to enable this has been changed to content.upload.dragndrop.

item.title: [SAK-22621] The Customize Tabs page of the Preferences Tool has screen reader accessibility issues
item.description:
The Customize Tabs page has numerous keyboard accessibility issues for users of screen reading software. Once tab focus is on the My Workspace item, arrowing does not select one of the sites as it would using only the keyboard. The screen reading software just reads the items as normal web content. A user of screen reading software must arrow to the desired course, press "Enter" in the area to activate a special mode to interact with the draggable items. They can then press control + arrow to move the selected site only once because the special mode deactivates after the key press. Users must navigate back to the drag and drop section of the page to interact with the sites because focus is moved out of that area. During the interactions (moving the sites from column to column) none of the actions are announced to users.This makes customizing the tabs extremely difficult for users of screen reading software. This is a spatial paradigm so it is not clear which arrows should be used to perform which function for non-sighted users.

Recommended remediation:

Modify the coding of the drag and drop section so that users of screen reading software can more easily customize the tabs. An alternative interface may be needed.
item.environment: sakai/trunk on Oracle - Built: 09/14/12 12:00 - Sakai Revision: 112462 (Kernel 1.4.0-SNAPSHOT)- Server sakai-nightly.uits.iupui.edu
item.summary: The Customize Tabs page of the Preferences Tool has screen reader accessibility issues

comments.comment:
Joe,

Could you please have the current version in trunk checked? Added a parallel way of reordering things that may be a first step, but needs a going over by someone knowledgeable.

Thanks!

Hi Joe,

Can you take a look at the new UI see if ameliorates this issue? Thanks.
Review new UI
The new UI has similar issues and new issues as well. I will write them all out in another post because it will take a while

The fluid reorderer tool though built with the intent of accessibility is not functionally accessible. All of the extra added aria attributes and labels cause more confusion for users of screen reading software (USRS) then providing helpful information. Do to the fact that each course div container has a role of article and an aria label the element reads out as # of # in column # of # movable article. This does not provide enough information to the user. Every other piece of content in the element is announced as draggable. In addition, the screen reading software accessible label for the check box for each course is announced multiple times which adds to the content users must navigate through. In terms of screen reading software keyboard accessibility, the only way to move a course from one column to another is to select the checkbox. The ctrl+arrow keys do not work with screen reading software (I tested JAWS, NVDA, Voiceover). When using the checkboxes, the links to move the selected item(s) from one column to another are not announced correctly because the alt attribute of the arrow image is being used as the announced link text, not the title attribute. For example, the left arrow is announced as Hide selected site. There is also a conflict with the access key for the left arrow (l), it conflicts with the jump to tools list link access key. Finally, those arrow links are loaded into the tool frame at the top of the frame so they are very hard to find for users of screen reading software.

The recommendations from multiple users of screen reading software would be to simplify the interactions. I suggest that you remove the aria attributes and labels to reduce the auditory clutter. Since the checkboxes work well, these should remain, but the hidden labels should be removed since the checkboxes have a title attribute. Text should be added after the course title in the checkboxs title attribute to indicate the column it is currently under. (e.g., select SMPL 101 Summer 2013 and move it from Favorite Sites) This text should be updated once a course is moved. The movement (arrow) links should be loaded right after the directions so they are easy to find for USRS. The alt text for the images should also be update so that the links are announced correctly. The column name should also be included in lieu of the directions. (e.g., Move selected sites to top of Favorite sites list or Move selected sites to top of Active sites list). The conflicting access key should be changed. I would recommend sticking to numbers instead of letters for access keys. Finally, the instructions should be modified to include screen reading software instructions and to denote that the keyboard instructions will not work with assistive technology. If these changes are not possible an alternative interface for USRS should be provided. USRS could move there courses int the old (2.7) combo box interface.

The tool is keyboard accessible when not using screen reading software.

item.title: [SAK-22608] User information table does not recieve focus for users of screen reading software on the Become User tool
item.description:
When a user of screen reading software attempts to view user information, focus remains on the "view user info" button. This may lead to confusion

Recommended Remediation:

Move focus to the "User Information" table. This could be accomplished with the tabindex attribute and jQuery

<caption class="listHier" tabindex="-1" id="userinfo">User Information</caption>

$("#userinfo").focus()
item.summary: User information table does not recieve focus for users of screen reading software on the Become User tool

comments.comment:
Joe,

I cannot reproduce this. Focus for me goes to the top of the framed doc, as it should. What am I missing? Thanks.
A screenshot with whatever highlights you think necessary would be good.

Did you test with screen reading software? When I activate the button the focus stays on the button and "JAWS" announces "view user info" button instead of focusing and announcing the table caption. Unfortunately, I do not think a screenshot will show the issue. I will try to capture a screencast.
No, I did not test with a SR. Am just surprised that the SR jumped over the table (and in other Jiras you have filed over other things as well)/ I am just wondering if it is a modes issue.

item.title: [SAK-22606] User account does not exist error message is not apparent to users of screen reading software on the Become User tool
item.description:
When a user of screen reading software attempts to become a user that does not exist, focus remains on the "become user" button. The Error message is not announced.

Recommended Remediation:

Move focus to the error message. This could be accomplished with the tabindex attribute and jQuery

<span class="alertMessage" id="alertMessage" tabindex="-1"> User account does not exist: jane doe </span>

$("#alertMessage").focus()
item.summary: User account does not exist error message is not apparent to users of screen reading software on the Become User tool

comments.comment:
Joe,

This is not an asynchronous operation - there is a round trip and the error message is contained in a new document, and a SR should read from top. Is there something else afoot? Is SR going into forms mode and bypassing the alert? Thanks.

If there is an error, focus should be forced to the error so it is immediately apparent to a user of screen reading software even if the page reloads or is a new document because the successful submission of the form is the purpose of the tool. http://www.w3.org/TR/2012/NOTE-WCAG20-TECHS-20120103/G139

item.title: [GAM-18] Revise browser scripts to make AJAX request directly to GAM "tool"
item.description:
This will switch the global alerts "tool" from using the courier to making its own AJAX requests, which will be handled by the GAM tool itself.

The browser scripts will make a request for config info on "startup" (what that means is to be determined) and then repeat that request periodically. By default, config info will be requested every 900 seconds (15 minutes) but it should be possible to change that period with a config setting.

The browser scripts should request messages soon after "startup" and repeat that request periodically. By default, the request for messages should be repeated every 90 seconds (1.5 minutes) but it should be possible to change that period with a config setting. Setting the refresh period to 0 should turn off requests for messages (but requests for config info should continue on their own schedule).

Additional properties may be added as the scripts are revised. Reasonable defaults should be set in the browser scripts for any new properties it expects to find in the config info received from the server.

The intention of the
item.summary: Revise browser scripts to make AJAX request directly to GAM "tool"

comments.comment:
1. Turn push model into a pull model. Browser requests configuration for poll timing for both configuration and messages, and polls for both at the stated intervals or to a default in the absence or mis-formed configuration setting (done)
2. Replace cookie mechanism for managing dismissed messages with sessionStorage to reduce interaction with server (done)
3. UI adjustments:
 a. replace x and v links with images
 b. update message display
 c. reconsider how to move priority 1 messages (cannot be dismissed, but may be needed to be moved by user if large so that can log out. etc).
diff containing portal changes needed
portal diff moved to SAK-23556

item.title: [UMICH-765] Modify existing roles to have site.visit realm permission in existing groups.
item.description:
Certain roles do not receive email from announcements that have been assigned to groups. The same roles do receive email from announcements sent site-wide. The group templates for sites and projects have already been modified. This task describes the process of updating roles in existing groups so that they too will have the site.visit permission.

The following roles will need to be modified in existing groups:

groups within project sites:
Organizer
Owner

groups with course sites:
Librarian
Observer
Owner
item.summary: Modify existing roles to have site.visit realm permission in existing groups.

comments.comment: We should first create a SQL query to determine the scope of the problem. Updating all group realms to set the site.visit permission for all roles in all groups could be done via SQL or web service.

I usually look at the kernel source code for the SQL examples for realm INSERT statements: sakai/kernel/kernel-impl/src/main/sql/oracle/sakai_realm.sql

For a query or queries, I think this should work -- note the ??? should be replaced with the role name(s) -- hopefully Chris can supply these.

SELECT REALM_ID FROM SAKAI_REALM WHERE REALM_KEY NOT IN
(
SELECT REALM_KEY FROM SAKAI_REALM_RL_FN WHERE ROLE_KEY in (select ROLE_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_ROLE where ROLE_NAME = '???') and FUNCTION KEY in (select FUNCTION_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_FUNCTION where FUNCTION_NAME = 'site.visit')
)

Executed the following query:
SELECT REALM_ID FROM SAKAI_REALM WHERE REALM_KEY NOT IN
(
SELECT REALM_KEY FROM SAKAI_REALM_RL_FN WHERE ROLE_KEY in (select ROLE_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_ROLE where ROLE_NAME = 'Organizer') and FUNCTION_KEY in (select FUNCTION_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_FUNCTION where FUNCTION_NAME = 'site.visit')
)
which returned 420 results on ctdev (testing there first). Of these, the realms that are returned seem to be a mixture of types. (myworkspace, course and additional items such as:
/site/8f334662-2be9-4bf9-9f54-fe6962afa77a/group/d1df3610-09b9-456c-a016-dfae73a76238
/content/group/gatewayadmin/CTools-2012.JPG

It feels like this query may be a bit too broad. I'll see if I can determine if it needs to be narrowed and narrow it appropriately.

the following query narrow the results down to just course or project sites. The ROLE_NAME and TYPE just need to be updated to reflect what you are looking for. This brings back a very small set of results for each type on CTDev.

SELECT * FROM SAKAI_REALM WHERE REALM_KEY NOT IN
(
SELECT REALM_KEY FROM SAKAI_REALM_RL_FN WHERE ROLE_KEY in (select ROLE_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_ROLE where ROLE_NAME = 'Observer')
and FUNCTION_KEY in (select FUNCTION_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_FUNCTION where FUNCTION_NAME = 'site.visit')
)
and substr(REALM_ID, 7, 36) IN (select SITE_ID from SAKAI_SITE where (TYPE = 'course'))
updated the query in the previous comment to function correctly. Ready for a first pass from Chris

The following updated query returned 21,970 results of Observers with no site.visit permission in production, so the problem is fairly broad.

SELECT count(*) FROM SAKAI_REALM WHERE REALM_KEY NOT IN
(
SELECT REALM_KEY FROM SAKAI_REALM_RL_FN WHERE ROLE_KEY in (select ROLE_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_ROLE where ROLE_NAME = 'Observer')
and FUNCTION_KEY in (select FUNCTION_KEY from SAKAI_REALM_FUNCTION where FUNCTION_NAME = 'site.visit')
)
and substr(REALM_ID, 7, 36) IN (select SITE_ID from SAKAI_SITE where (TYPE != 'myworkspace'))

Next step would be to determine whether SQL or web services would be best for solving this. I'd suggest trying SQL first.

item.title: [UMICH-807] UM Webmail page in My Workspace does not link to Google Mail for some users
item.description:
I have had a few calls recently with users going into their CTools site and there is a page/tool under My Workspace labeled UM Webmail. When selected it directs people to https://web.mail.umich.edu and the link does not work and directs the user to call 4-Help. The link appears for some people and not for others. I checked with others in the service center and it is mixed if they can see it.

I logged in with my uniqname rather than admin account and the UM Webmail link was present, and was not able to access the site since my IMAP has been disabled. The link only works for users who have not had their IMAP accounts disabled. Everyone else will get a blank page or a server interrupted page.

I have advised the users to use the M+Google link in the upper right, their reaction has been mixed. Is it possible to completely remove this web content link or make it work for Google.
item.summary: UM Webmail page in My Workspace does not link to Google Mail for some users

comments.comment: I think we should remove it. It's really nothing more than a Web Content tool pointed at U-M webmail, and we don't want to draw attention away from the Google links up in the corner (which is better placement anyway, why go to MWS to access your email when there's a link you can access no matter where you are in CTools?). I don't know how many people actually use this tool currently but the only support contacts over the year hav been to report that the link is no longer valid (which happens about once a year when they change things on the webmail side of things).
I would suggest completely removing this page from MyWorkspace with either a SQL query or webservice. It looks like it is not part of the default !user template for new users.
we'll want to have some type of message (MOTD, etc.) about it and prep the Service Center with boilerplate on the change (why, when, etc.).
UM Webmail page has been removed from the !user.uniqname template, so new users will not see this link. Remaining work is to remove for existing users.

I believe we'll need to remove all references to the Google Mail url from SAKAI_SITE_TOOL_PROPERTY (name='source', value='https://web.mail.umich.edu/') and related rows in SAKAI_SITE_TOOL, SAKAI_SITE_PAGE, SAKAI_SITE_PAGE_PROPERTY

item.title: [UMICH-732] Maintain users are unable to see existing files or upload new files to Modules (Melete)
item.description:
Maintain roles are unable to see previously uploaded contents in Upload folder of the Modules tool and attempting to upload new files to that folder generates an error. I am able to replicate this issue easily on both test sites and the original course sites.

This problem does not affect an Admin, I can see the existing files and upload new files without a problem. Likely a permissions issue but the role permissions are correctly set (melete.author is checked for Owner and Instructor roles) and there are no exposed permissions in the tool itself. Perhaps the problem is with the Upload folder permissions.

To reproduce:
Add a non-admin user to the production site that I duplicated from the original course site (d7714865-f4e4-4d0e-a0ff-a86aecde3719)
As that user, visit the Modules tool on that site and click on a section under any module to edit that section.
Click the Image icon in the toolbar of the editor.
Click Browse Server. The path for the uploads folder will display but no content is visible.
At the bottom of that page click Choose File, select an image file and click Choose. The window will close.
Click the Upload button in the lower right corner.
An error message will be displayed, "Error on file upload. Error number: 203" (see screenshot)
If you visit the same site as an admin and follow the above steps, contents of the folder will be visible and file upload will complete successfully and the image will appear in the textbox of the editor as expected.

Another issue was reported by the same user where they are prevented from sorting sections within a module. I was able to replicate on the original site as any user, including Admin but the problem does not occur on a duplicate of the site so I believe this particular issue is site specific. I mention here only because of the remote possibility that the two issues are related.
item.summary: Maintain users are unable to see existing files or upload new files to Modules (Melete)

comments.comment: A second user has reported this problem: INC 302838. The only workaround is to have a CTools Admin upload and insert images for the instructor.
Patrick, can you take a look and see if you can determine what is special about the misbehaving site and if the problem can be reproduced in CTQA?

item.title: [UMICH-379] Review & Load test search across all CTools sites and content
item.description:
Search is currently unavailable to course sites and limited availability on project sites. We need to determine:

1) How are other large institutions using Search?
2) Why does search not work on CtLoad?
3) Identify deficiencies of broad search capability (e.g. create load/stress test that includes broad search enabled)

Define a proposal to provide broad search capabilities for all sites & content within CTools.
item.summary: Review & Load test search across all CTools sites and content

comments.comment:
I know UCT is using search, it would certainly be worth discussing with them. Many issues still come up around search and Dave Horwitz is the only person that's done any work on it in the past 2 years or so.

Most of the concern that comes up on the mailing list is about corrupted indexes, and I think many places delete and regenerate the indexes on restart. I'm not sure how long this would take

We also don't know how much space all of the indexes for all of the content would take up on the search server. This would very likely require more disk space than we currently have available, and we'd probably want it to be on a fast local disk since it's on the search server, especially if it was heavily used.

We had discussed at one time adding properties to disable some functionality (like disabling large document searching) while retaining other searching. There really is a lot of questions around this and it seems like there would be some work once we found out what was really needed.

The first time around the space demands for implementing cluster wide search were not practical. I think they have come down quite a bit since then.

Search is designed to either run on all the app servers or on a single search server. If necessary it would be possible to develop an approach that uses multiple search servers. That would segregate the search work from app servers but still be scalable.

As Matt suggests it is important to know how long it would take to completely redo search indexing for all of CTools. We are likely to have to do that at some point.
See https://request.umich.edu/MRcgi/MRentrancePage.pl?PROJECTID=314&MR=104 for CtLoad issues

item.title: [UMICH-6] Add automatic friend invitations to CTools

Adding friend accounts to sites for new friend accounts would be easier if email
addresses added to a site were automatically checked to ensure that the friend

invited to use it.

/svn/ctools/jonespm/friendtest

This code just needs a slight cleanup and some integration with site management somehow. Would be nice to investigate how to do this before the Fall semester starts.

On Jul 15, 2011, at 3:51 PM, Perpich, Diana wrote:

...the auto-invite should include:

1- the (accurate) contact info for the actual site.
2- the actual tab name for the site (not just a link to ctools).
3- a check so that it doesn't get sent to UMD and Flint people because someone entered an @umd.umich.edu or @flint.umich.edu address.

4. (pipe dream) a link right to the Friend Request form instead of a link to the overwritten How To Become a Friend page.

From Matthew:

From what I remember, nothing was needed from site-info, but we did need a modification to UserDirectoryService to handle a new provider call. The provider call was documented and added to a sample at one time, but doesn't actually work. (SAK-2422)

Then I just need to dump the code I've got from the sample I was testing with actually into the provider.

The code for this was in wush somewhere, I think at the path that zhen mentioned. It wasn't finished though as it needed an event watcher added to the provider or something added to site management to watch for new non-official accounts. item.title: [SAK-23517] Standardize the parsing of grades in assignments
item.description:
It seems like the parsing of grades files (csv) in assignments has gotten overly complex, and the partial patch against SAK-21816 has only worsened the problem by introducing tab separated values into a comma separated file.

What I'm proposing to do is to change both reading and writing these grade files to a library (opencsv). CSV files don't support UTF8 but TSV has better support especially for reading into Excel.

So Assignment should use this library to write a file with a .tsv extension into the zip file with all tab separation. When it reads, it can either use csv or tsv for old compatibility.

Needs to

Write
- Write out the grades as a TSV (BaseAssignmentService -> zipGroupSubmissions - gradesBuffer)

Read
- Read in grades as either a TSV or CSV based on extension
  AssignmentAction.java -> uploadAll_parseZipFile
item.summary: Standardize the parsing of grades in assignments

comments.comment: Assigning over to Zhen to review. I tested this and it seems to resolve all the issues with grade book parsing.
This patch file includes fixes from SAK-23536
Patch is from svn diff -r 123107:123289 https://source.sakaiproject.org/svn/msub/longsight.com/assignment/SAK-21816
reopening b/c it isn't committed to trunk
We're testing this out again locally.
The patch looks good to me. Could you please merge it into trunk after your local test passes?

Create a new course/project with the assignment tool.

Go to Site Info, add the users
??
comma user

Points Grading, fill in required fields and points

Hit grade on this assignment
Add in a default grade of something less than the points click apply
Click Download All
Click All, Click Download, it should download a bulk_download zip file (you might have to click link)
Uncompress zip file, try to open grades.csv

It looks like you can open *if* you switch to tab separator in Excel but then try to re-upload, none of it was working for me. No grades are uploaded

The patch attached switches everything to csv on both read and write, and works correctly if the end user switches to UTF-8 for file reading for international characters.

item.title: [DASH-250] dashboard tool needs to provide a conversion script for all dashboard table creations
item.description: For universities like UMICH have auto.ddl set to false, dashboard tool needs to provide a db conversion script for all its table creations.
item.summary: dashboard tool needs to provide a conversion script for all dashboard table creations

comments.comment: conversion scripts have been added for Oracle, MySQL, and HSQL.

Please add following to (at least) Oracle conversion:

create index DASH_CALENDAR_LINK_ITEM_ID_IDX on DASH_CALENDAR_LINK(item_id) tablespace ctools_indexes

We should also ask Drew if it makes sense to have a NEWS_LINK index

Drew has added the following index into ctload db:

 create index DASH_NEWS_LINK_PERSON_ID_IDX on DASH_NEWS_LINK(PERSON_ID) tablespace ctools_indexes;


This is to help with the following query:

2g9yy1dj6tns9

select person.sakai_id from dash_person person join dash_news_link link on link.
person_id=person.id join dash_news_item item on link.item_id=item.id where item.
entity_ref=:1

We are waiting for the ctload AWR report stats to show the effectiveness of this index.

On the other hand, we may want to do similar things to help with query "select person.sakai_id from dash_person person join dash_calendar_link link on link.person_id=person.id join dash_calendar_item item on link.item_id=item.id where item.entity_ref=? ". But since it has not poped up as top queries on the AWR report, we do not plan to add index as of now.

The previous index:

 create index DASH_NEWS_LINK_PERSON_ID_IDX on DASH_NEWS_LINK(PERSON_ID)

did not have impact on performance.

Drew has hence added another index on ITEM_ID, as shown below. We will see whether this one is effective:

DASH_NEWS_LINK_ITEM_ID_IDX on DASH_NEWS_LINK(ITEM_ID)

item.title: [SAK-19289] Extraneous Log Events Recorded When New Site is Createdw
item.description:
Some (not all) tools log a "new" event when they are initially turned on.

These events are pretty confusing, especially when trying to determine what tools are actually being used. For example, the Email Archive tool generates a "mail.new" event when the channel is created, but new messages sent to the Email Archive also generate "mail.new" events, so it can become difficult to differentiate between the different events, particularly if the interest is identifying user activity within the system.

Possible solution:
Rename initial log events that occur when the tool is first turned on for a site.
(e.g. when resources tool creates the root folder: content.setup instead of content.new)
item.summary: Extraneous Log Events Recorded When New Site is Createdw

comments.comment: Can folks commit to fixing the remaining sub-tasks for this bug for 2.6 to help improve tracking and statistics?
I've changed the sub-tasks to suggest using ".create" rather than ".setup", since this is what the emailArchive uses and what I will use in Calendar for consistency.

[Bulk Comment] This is issue is currently scheduled to be resolved for inclusion in the Sakai 2.6.0 release, however, it is still unresolved. If you still planning on resolving it, please reply with a comment indicating when you expect to have it resolved. If you don't think you will be able to address this issue in time for the release, please reply with a comment indicating such; particularly if this issue is Blocker or Critical priority. If the resolution of this issue is to be delayed until a future release (i.e., 2.7), then please update the Fix Version accordingly.
Moved the messages and forums sub task into that project and am linking this issue that that one.

item.title: [TLPSO-38] Creating a site from the HIPAA template results in duplicate Web Content tools being added to the site.

To duplicate:

2) Click "Done - go to site"

It is possible that this template was somehow corrupted when the Site Archive tool was used to move it between CTQA and Prod.

The workaround is to remove the duplicate tools.
item.summary: Creating a site from the HIPAA template results in duplicate Web Content tools being added to the site.

comments.comment:
I notice a few odd things:
1) The problem is not reproducible on CTQA
2) The "What is HIPAA?" web content URL in the original template is invalid (url = http://whatishipaa.org/hipaa-compliance.php) - Jeff, could you correct this to see if it makes any difference?

That URL is valid on the template - Web Content resolves to the correct site. I replaced the URL anyway to see if it helped but the Web Contents still duped. "What is HIPAA?" and "HIPAA Guide" won't resolve on created sites because those URLs get mangled by having the site id inserted into the URLs when the site is created:

http://whatis76d3de4e-7a9c-48c1-832e-31c2c3107a66.org/76d3de4e-7a9c-48c1-832e-31c2c3107a66-compliance.php

item.title: [TLPSO-36] Query content_resources table to find instances of use of metadata tags
item.description:
Resources improvement project needs usage data to determine the importance of allowing user to update metadata fields when uploading files. To this end, we should examine the content_resources table for files uploaded since August 1. Specifically, we should look for the following tags in the 'binary_entity' column of this table.

CHEF:copyrightchoice != 'Material is in public domain.' or 'public_domain'
CHEF:copyrightalert = true. If this tag exists the option is set. Can just check for the presence of this tag.
CHEF:description. If this tag exists the option is set. Can just check for the presence of this tag.

I cannot see where in the blob the 'display' information is displayed. This would also be important to note.
item.summary: Query content_resources table to find instances of use of metadata tags

comments.comment:
This covers more than just metadata of individual items I realize.

Site
  # of resources
  # folders
  # folder depth
  # number of different types
  ? permission changes?
  ? option changes?
  # total size

Site churn (hard, event driven)
  # deletions
  # moves
  # replaces
  # permission edits
  # detail edits
  # reordering changes

Resource properties
  ? description
  # description length
  ? copyright change from default
  ? force copyright display
  ? public
  ? site only
  ? visibility tweaked?
    - tricky, we may be able to pinpoint NOW, but not the past or the future
  ? optional Dublin Core properties used
  ? notification, change from default
  # changed to what

Folder properties
  ? permissions tweaked
  # changed to what
  ? order tweaked
The original 3 questions can be answered by looking for text string in the blob data.

item.title: [TLKAN-1] Create unified Kanban Board
item.description:
We would like to have a single Kanban board that aggregates issues from both the ITS and Sakai JIRA instances. The Kanban board should initially have 3 columns (see screenshot) based on the JIRA status. Issues should initially be sorted by assignee. The intent is to provide T&L staff with a single Kanban board to see what needs to be done, what is actively being worked on, and what needs QA.

1. To-Do == Open, Reopened, Awaiting Review
2. In Progress == In Progress, Development in Progress
3. QA == Resolved, QA Testing

Each table cell in the kanban board should have the following:
1. Title (key+summary), with live link to URL
2. Assignee
3. Reporter
4. Label(s)

We should also add the ability to filter the web page (dom), as is done in pdash.ctools.org.

Out-of-scope features include WIP (work in progress) indication, project swimlanes, sorting, etc.
item.summary: Create unified Kanban Board

item.title: [TLGCIC-63] Sakai Google Calendar must work with IE
item.description:
The Sakai Google Calendar tool currently does not display any events when viewed from IE 8. We need to make sure the tool displays correctly for the latest version of the following browsers:

1) IE
2) Chrome
3) Firefox
4) Safari
item.summary: Sakai Google Calendar must work with IE

comments.comment: We need an HTTPS server to run IE against. IE will not work making AJAX calls to Google HTTPS servers when GCalendar is running on insecure HTTP server.
We have two HTTPS servers - one on durango (Ray has this for M+Google), and one on deluxe - Richard can have this as soon as his access is granted.
I am working on this one, Using jsonp has helped a lot with the gets in IE, unfortunately it did not help with posting new events.

I have this working again. The root issue was that on Safari, Chrome, etc, retrieving events from Google can be done via a synchronous ajax call., however, in IE they must be done asynchronously. Further, posts must be done via a secure connection. I have moved the latest version of the Google calendar code to Deluxe. I need help running my instance securely. Once that is done, I will test adding events and dropping events in Deluxe and turn move this to QA testing.

Adding events and dropping events don't work outside the ssl environment. The other calendar events do.
To make IE work, in all its incarnations, we converted it to use the proxy server. Additionally, IE9 allows you to create and event but not move it.

item.title: [TLGCIC-41] Add support for email notification for Google calendar events
item.description:
Users creating events can configure email notifications, at either the site level, or for individual events (TBD). Based on the configured options, site members should receive notifications for the following:

1. New events
2. Changed events
3. Canceled events
4. Confirmed events (receive notification when guest responds to event, if user has gcal.view.all permission, as described in TLGCIC-4)

Additionally, site members can optionally receive a daily email with all events for that day at 5am.

Individual users should be able to opt in/out of these emails based on their My Workspace -> Preferences.

These requirements should be reviewed/revised based on an assessment of effort, looking both at the Google and Sakai framework for sending notifications.
item.summary: Add support for email notification for Google calendar events

item.title: [TLGCIC-24] Support click-n-drag option to create a new calendar event
item.description:
Users should be able to use their mouse to click-n-drag over a specified date/time period to create an event - simulating the same user experience from the Google Calendar UI.

1. A single click in the all day section will create an all-day event (date will be displayed in dialog window)
2. A single click in the hourly section will create a 1 hour event (time will be displayed in the dialog window)
3. A click-and-drag mouse event in the all day section will create an all-day event spanning the selected dates (start & end date will be displayed in dialog window)
4. A click-and-drag mouse event in the hourly section will create a timed event spanning the specified times (start and end time will be specified in the dialog window) - EXCEPT FOR RECURRING EVENTS. Recurring events will display a message and take the user to the Google dialog box to update the recurring event.
5. A drag and drop mouse event for all day events will move the event to the desired date.
6. A drag and drop mouse event for timed events will move the event to the desired date and time.

In all cases, the user will be given the option to edit the event from the initial create event dialog window, where they can modify all the usual google calendar attributes, include: time, date, frequency, description, location, etc.

KNOWN ISSUES: In IE 9, you cannot drag or enlarge an event. This is an issue with using two jquery version in the velocity template. When I re-organize the order of these include files, you can not create and event, but you can move them. It seems better to be able to create an event than to move it for now. This is a know issue in jquery.
item.summary: Support click-n-drag option to create a new calendar event

comments.comment: The click-n-drag method of entry seemed a bit ambitious for our initial release, but if you are confident in going this route, I will not argue. We will especially want to consider what will be the accessible alternative.
I've created TLGCIC-27 for accessibility concerns
IE does not work, but in Firefox, one can drag and drop and extend the time on certain events.
I just updated the code on Deluxe to have the latest drag and drop/drag time code. It seemed to work well in Firefox.
It seems to work well in Chrome. We do have issues with IE. We have a card for IE issues.
Works well for me in Safari, FF, and Chrome.
I am waiting for help with the error processing and messages.

I added the following above:
- EXCEPT FOR RECURRING EVENTS. Recurring events will display a message and take the user to the Google dialog box to update the recurring event.
Another option that I can investigate is to make recurring events so they are not re-sizable.
Please let me know what you think of the recurring event implementation. Also, we will work on the IE issues under a different Jira card.

I believe I tried every possible drag and drop combination successfully. Even dragging a timed event to a full day event (and visa-verse) works.

I did notice I could move reoccurring events in the month view w/o getting an alert to use the google calendar. There were a also few occasions were I didn't immediately receive an alert when moving a recurring event in the Week view.

I recommend changing the recurring event alert text to : "Recurring events can be edited in the full version of Google Calendar"

I have update the message. Please see if you can move the events that you mention in the second paragraph directly in Google. If you can move them without the dialog popping up, then you should be able to move them within Sakai. If you get the popup in Google, then you should get the popup in Sakai.

Please let me know if there is something I need to change.

item.title: [TLGCIC-7] Create Sakai Contrib Tool that integrates Google Calendar (v1.0 release)
item.description:
We would like to develop a Sakai tool that integrates a Google Calendar into a Sakai site. The Sakai roster/users should have access to the google calendar, the google calendar should be named after the Sakai site and accessible both within and without Sakai.

Google calendar events will not (initially) be group aware.
item.summary: Create Sakai Contrib Tool that integrates Google Calendar (v1.0 release)

comments.comment:
Test Accounts: test@collab.its.umich.edu and test1@collab.its.umich.edu
https://www.google.com/a/cpanel/collab.its.umich.edu/UserHub

item.title: [TLGCIC-4] Provide configurable mapping between Sakai permissions and Google permissions
item.description:
Sakai site members need to have delegated write access to the google calendar if the corresponding sakai permission is set. They should have the same permissions within Sakai and within Google, unless they do not have a google account.

Sakai permissions <-> Google Permission mapping:

gcal.view = See only free/busy (hide details)
gcal.view.all = See all event details
gcal.edit = Make changes to events
gcal.admin = Make changes AND manage sharing

If a user does not have a google account, will not be able to view (or edit) the calendar outside of the Sakai Google Calendar view. If such a user is granted permissions that they cannot exercise (since they do not have a google account), a warning should be logged when the permissions are checked.

We also need to respond to permissions changes in Sakai, after a user already has access to a google calendar, and translate them into google authz changes. Perhaps this could be done when the GCalendar tool checks if the google calendar is shared with a user when tool is first accessed in a session?
item.summary: Provide configurable mapping between Sakai permissions and Google permissions

comments.comment: This role mapping document may be helpful: https://docs.google.com/a/umich.edu/spreadsheet/ccc?key=0AjJhIHIMWzTHdFFWLWN2SUNGRjZUWGs1LTYweHE3dmc#gid=3
Initial pass committed to the repository. Monday I will build it on Deluxe.

item.title: [TLGCIC-27] Update Sakai Google UI for accessibility
item.description:
Review and define accessibility improvements, including (but not limited to):

1. Create a button to add an event (defaults to the current date)
2. Allow user to select & edit event with keyboard (e.g. tab will cycle through defined events, enter will bring up event edit dialog)
item.summary: Update Sakai Google UI for accessibility

comments.comment:
1. Create a button to add an event (defaults to the current date)

   - ok - it would be preferable if the user could keyboard into a date and trigger the dialog (with that date's values) with Enter key. Maybe both. For that the plugin would need to be modified.

2. Allow user to select & edit event with keyboard (e.g. tab will cycle through defined events, enter will bring up event edit dialog)

 - we are going to have to modify the full-calendar plugin for this

Other:

- none of the controls (like the navigation ones) provided by the plugin is a link - they are all spans, more modifications to the plug in are needed
- the form inside the dialog needs work, the inputs and the labels are not related. This is an easy fix that does not affect the plugin, since it is our stuff.

Note: it would be best if we could submit a patch to the plugin creator rather than patch our version. This way we could upgrade if needed.
See https://code.google.com/p/fullcalendar/issues/detail?id=637 On Aug 18, 2013 support for keyboard access, tabbing was accepted as an open issue. It has been requested since Oct of 2010.
2 years +. So we can assume it is not going to happen. Has the plugin had much activity for the past year or so?

item.title: [TLOPE-11] SRCAA: Need to change the format of the score being received from CTools to M-Pathways for Placement Exams
item.description:
The format of the score coming from CTools for Spanish Placement Exams needs to be changed. The current code is LLRR.SY. This needs to be changed to RRLL.SY. This is the web service load that interacts with msr05008.sqr to give the appropriate Spanish placement score.

Due Date: The RO will go back to the old process of manipulating the data and then upload the scores to M-Pathways.
item.summary: SRCAA: Need to change the format of the score being received from CTools to M-Pathways for Placement Exams

comments.comment: Assigning to Carmen for when she returns from vacation.
HE-29461 CSR created for development work.

I made the following changes to the Application Package: M_SR_PLC_EXAM.PutPlcExamScores
1. Read the input "GradePoints" field from Test Center as RRLL.SY instead of LLRR.SY
     Verified by doing "select * from ps_m_sr_plc_webld" and looking at the Reading Field and the Listening field.
2. Changed the "Years Studied" evaluation logic so that a BLANK years studied translates to a Blank (as apposed to a 4).
3. Changed the EMPLID look up code so that if an emplid is not found using the campus id.. the campus ID is retained in the table. This will help with troubleshooting those tests that could be sent keyed by campus id where Mpathways does not have a matching campus id to get the emplid from.

System test should include 1) reading and listening scores in LLRR format, 2) Blank Years studied, and 3) a campus ID that is not recognized in Mpathways.
Ready for System Testing. See above comments about the 3 changes made to the application package handler code in the web service. NO CHANGES were made to the SQR (msr05008).
TESTING RESULTS shown here.
Working on getting the translation of the score into the format that Mapthways needs.

item.title: [TLGCIC-72] Review/revise access permissions when removing a folder
item.description:
Roster access permissions are handled in LTI Provider servlet:
1. If student logs in and tries to view the LTI, and does not have permissions, the browser sends request to LTI Provider servlet to get it, and it does that right away.
2. When instructor links folder, the permissions for the roster are generated right away, and it asks the user if Google should send email to the students for their new permissions.
3. When instructor unlinks folder, access permissions are removed. This is done in stupid way, as the LTI Provider servlet does not know what access exists. The only way to find out about an individual's permissions is to insert them, so it inserts permission for each student, and then removes it.
 
We should review whether or not it makes sense for the LTI Provider servlet to save roster access so that removing access is more efficient.
item.summary: Review/revise access permissions when removing a folder

item.title: [TLGCIC-73] Refactor LTI ClientSSLWrapper class and Verify SSL Certificates
item.description:
HTTPS server certificates always accepted: see edu.umich.its.lti.utils.ClientSslWrapper in lti-utils. This is insecure, so the code needs to be revised to verify the SSL certs.

Additionally, this class should be refactored to support multiple LTI Providers, including the Qualtrics LTI Provider application.
item.summary: Refactor LTI ClientSSLWrapper class and Verify SSL Certificates

item.title: [TLRD-3] Ctools site for all roles of an academic program
item.description:
From ITSM:

We have had a request for a CTools site that would span all students with a
particular major, automatically adding them to the site.
I know we had this come up before and it was not possible then, but I
thought since this is a newer version of CTools, it may be possible now.
item.summary: Ctools site for all roles of an academic program

comments.comment:
I think UMIAC would be the best place to create a group like this. We already have a contrived UMIAC 'TEACH' roster that's constructed for the 'Faculty Business' site (https://ctools.umich.edu/portal/site/instructors).

A new roster is created every term for all active faculty, for example:
2013,3,A,TEACH,000,000

The downside of this is it's really slow to load, and no one supporting UMIAC knows how exactly this roster is populated.
